title: 107_hr822
content: The Act titled "Medicare Certified Registered Nurse First Assistant Direct Reimbursement Act of 2001" allows Medicare coverage for surgical first assisting services provided by Certified Registered Nurse First Assistants. The Act allows Medicare coverage for surgical first assisting services provided by Certified Registered Nurse First Assistants, as defined in the Social Security Act. The Medicare, Medicaid, and SCHIP Benefits Improvement and Protection Act of 2000 is amended to include coverage for surgical first assisting services provided by Certified Registered Nurse First Assistants. The Medicare, Medicaid, and SCHIP Benefits Improvement and Protection Act of 2000 now covers surgical first assisting services provided by Certified Registered Nurse First Assistants. The Medicare, Medicaid, and SCHIP Benefits Improvement and Protection Act of 2000 now covers surgical first assisting services provided by Certified Registered Nurse First Assistants, who are registered nurses licensed to practice nursing in the state where the services are performed, have completed 2,000 hours of assisting in surgery, and are certified as a registered nurse first assistant. The Medicare, Medicaid, and SCHIP Benefits Improvement and Protection Act of 2000 covers surgical first assisting services provided by Certified Registered Nurse First Assistants, who are registered nurses licensed to practice nursing in the state where the services are performed and have completed 2,000 hours of assisting in surgery. Certified Registered Nurse First Assistants must also be certified by an organization recognized by the Secretary. Payment for these services is set at 80 percent of the lesser of the actual charge or 85 percent of the fee schedule amount. The Medicare, Medicaid, and SCHIP Benefits Improvement and Protection Act of 2000 covers surgical first assisting services provided by Certified Registered Nurse First Assistants. Payment for these services is set at 80 percent of the fee schedule amount determined under section 1848(b) for the same services if furnished by a physician. Amendments are made to sections 1833(r) and 1842(b)(18)(C)(i) of the Social Security Act to include surgical first assisting services. The Medicare, Medicaid, and SCHIP Benefits Improvement and Protection Act of 2000 covers surgical first assisting services provided by Certified Registered Nurse First Assistants. Amendments are made to sections 1833(r) and 1842(b)(18)(C)(i) of the Social Security Act to include surgical first assisting services in payment regulations. Additionally, there is a provision to reduce payments to hospitals to avoid duplicate payments for surgical first assisting services. The Medicare, Medicaid, and SCHIP Benefits Improvement and Protection Act of 2000 includes surgical first assisting services by Certified Registered Nurse First Assistants in payment regulations. Amendments apply to services provided after the enactment date of the Act. The Secretary of Health and Human Services must submit a report to Congress within 180 days of the Act's enactment, with recommendations for adjusting payment rates for surgical first assisting services by certified registered nurse first assistants under part B of title XVIII of the Social Security Act. This is to ensure that payment amounts reflect the costs of providing such services, including compensation, overhead, and supervision.
